business.headline: Capital gains tax was meant to be simpler. Here's why it feels harder nowSelling a long-held asset used to be a fairly predictable exercise. Inflation was factored in through indexation, the tax rate was known, and the final bill rarely came as a shock. That sense of certainty has faded.

What education sector wants from Budget 2026: Skills, quality and jobsWith India's youth population at the centre of its growth story, the education sector sees Budget 2026 as a chance to invest in better teachers, relevant skills and stronger pathways to jobs.

Tata Technologies' Q3 profit plunges 96% on one-time labour code chargeThe new labour rules, which came into effect in November, require employee wages to make up at least 50% of the total cost to company. Benefits such as provident fund and gratuity must now be calculated based on wages, raising costs for employers.

Gold and silver ETFs at record highs: Should you sell now or buy more?Gold and silver prices have climbed to record highs, pulling their ETFs up sharply as well. With returns looking attractive, investors are now facing a key question, i.e., is this the right time to book profits or stay invested? Let's have a look.

Will gold prices stay near record highs despite easing safe-haven demand?Gold prices are hovering near record highs even as some safe-haven demand fades, raising questions about whether support from interest rate cut expectations and global uncertainty will be enough to keep prices elevated.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by IT stocks; Infosys gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 187.74 points to settle at 83,570.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 28.75 points to close at 25,694.35​​​​​​​.

Budget 2026: What India's middle class is really asking forWith Budget 2026 around the corner, India's middle class is hoping for relief that actually touches daily life, from jobs and inflation to housing and healthcare, so what is it really asking the government to deliver?

Are frequent market holidays holding India back as a global investment hub?In a post on X, Kamath said that shutting stock exchanges for a local municipal election shows poor planning, especially at a time when Indian markets have strong international linkages and global investor participation.

BCCL IPO listing date changed: Check new debut date, GMP and expected profitBCCL share price: Expectations around listing gains remain strong, as the grey market premium, or GMP, has moved higher. However, the stock's listing has been delayed, pushing the debut to a later date.

IMF likely to upgrade India's GDP forecast after Q3 growth exceeds expectationsIndia's third-quarter growth turned out to be better than expected. This has increased the chances of an upward revision in the IMF's outlook.

Can Budget 2026 address tax, talent and cost pressures in tourism and hospitality?Industry voices highlight the need for skilling reforms, tax incentives, and policy support to drive growth and innovation in India's tourism and hospitality sector.

Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

Budget 2026: From mental health to medtech, healthcare seeks policy pushAhead of Union Budget 2026, voices from across the healthcare ecosystem are drawing attention to long-standing gaps. While funding has improved in recent years, experts say sharper policy focus is needed on mental health, medtech and early diagnosis.

entertainment.headline: Refused to meet me: Kangana recalls her AR Rahman experience during Emergency Bollywood actor Kangana Ranaut has publicly criticised composer AR Rahman for declining to meet her regarding her directorial film Emergency, alleging prejudice and partiality.

Don 3 casting rumours debunked as insiders deny Atlee, Hrithik Roshan link Speculation regarding the involvement of director Atlee and actor Hrithik Roshan in Don 3 has been dismissed by sources close to the project.

Ram Charan gets into beast mode as he gears up for Peddi shoot Behind-the-scenes glimpses of Ram Charan's physical preparation for the rural sports action film Peddi emerge, as the production team gears up for upcoming schedules.

Allu Arjun spends family time in Tokyo with Sneha Reddy and children Allu Arjun, currently in Tokyo to promote the Japanese-dubbed version of Pushpa 2: The Rule, took time off from his commitments to visit the Sensoji Temple with his family, sharing moments with his wife Sneha Reddy and children in Japan's capital.

Vijay's Theri vs Ajith's Mankatha: Amid Jana Nayagan row, clash of re-releases The 2016 action drama Theri, starring Vijay, is set for a theatrical re-release on January 23, coinciding with the re-release of Ajith Kumar's Mankatha.

Ajith Kumar chats with Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan at Dubai 24H Series. Viral video Actor Ajith Kumar's racing pursuits, including his participation in the Dubai 24H Series, are set to feature in a new docu-film by director A L Vijay. The project aims to inspire young people and raise awareness about motorsport in India.

Ram Charan on setbacks and the perks of being Chiranjeevi's son Actor Ram Charan reflected on his approach to success and failure, discussed the advantage of growing up in a film family, and shared insights into his upcoming role in Peddi.

Sunita Ahuja says she won't forgive Govinda if his cheating is ever confirmed In a recent podcast promo, Sunita Ahuja addressed ongoing rumours of marital issues with actor Govinda, speaking candidly about alleged affairs and concerns over family matters, while reaffirming their relationship status.

Kangana Ranaut joins 2026 is the new 2016 trend, revisits past turmoil Actor Kangana Ranaut has revisited the turbulent events of 2016, including her public legal dispute with Hrithik Roshan, by participating in the '2026 is the new 2016' trend on Instagram.

I hate him, but…: Parul Gulati's surprising take on Karan Aujla cheating row Actor Parul Gulati has publicly voiced support for Punjabi singer Karan Aujla amid allegations of infidelity, dismissing accuser Ms Gori's statements as unfounded.

Javed Akhtar reacts to AR Rahman's remark on the film industry becoming communal AR Rahman recently spoke about getting fewer opportunities in Bollywood and hinted at communal bias. Lyricist Javed Akhtar disagrees, saying Rahman is widely respected and that his own choices are driven by artistic integrity.

25 years of madness: Akshay Kumar marks anniversary with playful reel of Twinkle Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna celebrated 25 years of marriage with playful social media posts, sharing laughter-filled memories that continue to delight their fans.

AR Rahman blames Bollywood for his decline, but post-2015 duds hurt his legacy too In a recent interview, AR Rahman blamed his recent Bollywood slowdown on non-creative power shifts and communal whispers. Truth is, his post-2015 duds contributed to his decline.

Can This Love Be Translated review: Kim Seon-ho returns with a soft, fluent charmRelease Date:Fri Jan 16, 2026 Netflix's new K-drama Can This Love Be Translated treats romance as an emotional journey built on patience and understanding rather than perfect fluency. With its thoughtful take on miscommunication, mental health and intimacy, the show stands out for its grounded performances and gentle storytelling.

CBFC chairman Prasoon Joshi on the censor certification debate: Exclusive Prasoon Joshi said the debate over whether the CBFC acts as a censor or certifier is complex, noting that the board tries to balance creative expression with societal values. He stressed dialogue over confrontation, acknowledging the differing viewpoints involved.

Singer Shaan rejects bias notion after AR Rahman's remark: Music is merit-driven Singers AR Rahman and Shaan recently shared differing views about the role of communal factors in the Hindi music industry, sparking a public conversation on creative opportunities and industry dynamics.

The rise of the red-flag hero in Bollywood Bollywood witnesses a shift as flawed and ruthless leads dominate the box office, reflecting a new-age realism that resonates with today's audience. These anti-heroes, far from perfect, are not aspirational. They capture life's messy truths, and depart from traditional charming protagonists.

Alia Bhatt posts 2016 throwbacks, fans call it their 'favourite Alia phase' Alia Bhatt reflected on her successful year in 2016 by posting a series of throwback photos on Instagram, joining a trend where celebrities revisit their memorable moments from a decade ago.

Jennifer Lawrence says being called ugly cost her Margot Robbie's Sharon Tate role Jennifer Lawrence has shared her experiences of missing out on roles in Quentin Tarantino's films, including turning down part in The Hateful Eight and losing out on Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, amidst online commentary about her appearance.

general news.headline: Trump slaps 10% tariffs on Denmark, France, others from Feb 1 over Greenland issueThe US President warned that the tariff would rise to 25 per cent from June 1, 2026, if no agreement is reached on Greenland.

IndiGo fined Rs 22 crore for delay chaos, airline faulted for bad rostering, weak planningIndiGo has been fined Rs 22 crore after an aviation regulator's probe found that overworked crew rosters, weak planning and inadequate implementation of revised duty time norms led to widespread flight delays and cancellations.

Resort politics back in Mumbai as Shinde Sena moves corporators to 5-star hotelAmid intense bargaining over control of BMC, Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has moved his Shiv Sena faction's 29 corporators to a five-star hotel in Mumbai to prevent poaching, reviving memories of past resort politics in Maharashtra.

Strictest pollution curbs under GRAP-4 back as Delhi air turns severe, AQI at 428According to official data, Delhi's AQI stood at 400 at around 4 pm on January 17, but showed a rapid upward trend and worsened to 428 by 8 pm.

Did India silently strike back at Trump by taxing US pulses?In the letter to Trump, the senators flagged that India imposed a 30% tariff on US yellow peas on October 30 last year. The move went largely unnoticed and was not publicised by the government, revealing the delicate balancing act by India.

Liberation, not regime change: Activist Gazelle Sharmahd on Iran protests endgameSpeaking to India Today, Gazelle Sharmahd rejected the term "regime change," characterising the ongoing uprising in Iran as a "liberation" from a "foreign occupying murderous regime."

Shubman Gill carries water purifier worth Rs 3 lakh to Indore: ReportIndia captain Shubman Gill has reportedly carried a water purification assembly worth Rs 3 lakh to Indore. Recently, a severe water crisis broke out in Indore which claimed the lives of 23 people.

Another Sena split? Uddhav says Eknath Shinde scared of BJP amid resort politicsUddhav Thackeray, in his first remarks after the BMC election results, hinted that the Shinde Sena faction might see a split amid a tussle to take control of India's richest civic body.

Devendra to Deva Bhau: Maha civic polls mark Fadnavis' defining political momentThe biggest takeaway from the BMC battle is inarguably the exceptionally capable leadership of Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. He single-handedly did all the heavy lifting, criss-crossed the state to campaign, and fended off tough questions from the media as well as criticism from both the Opposition and allies like Ajit Pawar.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 14 | Epic Clash of Faiths: When Tamil Turned Mass MediumPundits and laypersons, Tamil Nadu confounds everybody alike. What makes it the strongest citadel of regionalism in contemporary politics that is now soaked in nationalism? Why is it a unique entity even among its culturally similar southern states?

Hindu trader, 60, beaten to death in Bangladesh as anti-minority violence continuesThe victim, named Liton Chandra Das, had a minor argument with customers, which escalated to a physical altercation that led to his death.

India, Bangladesh players shake hands in U19 World Cup after BCB clarificationU19 World Cup: India and Bangladesh players shook hands at the end of the game after the toss controversy at the start of the match. The gestures were made after Bangladesh Cricket Board issued a public clarification on the issue.

Vijay's Theri vs Ajith's Mankatha: Amid Jana Nayagan row, clash of re-releasesThe 2016 action drama Theri, starring Vijay, is set for a theatrical re-release on January 23, coinciding with the re-release of Ajith Kumar's Mankatha.

Change World Cup groups: Bangladesh propose radical idea to avoid India travelBangladesh have proposed the idea of changing their group for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 to minimise their travel to India. The BCB has released a press note on the developments from the meeting.

Trump tariffs behind rise in school dropouts in Surat?Trump's sky-high 50% tariff on India not only has dimmed the sparkle of Gujarat's lifeline diamond industry, but its impact also seems to have reached the classrooms as well. The domino effect has especially affected Surat, the 'Diamond City' of India, with several children dropping out of schools mid-session last year.

Winning silver is losing: Mindset that made Phelps the greatest ever OlympianMichael Phelps has reiterated the ruthless winning mindset that defined his career, dismissing silver and bronze medals as losses rather than achievements. Across five Olympic Games, he won 28 medals, but insists only his 23 golds truly mattered to him.

Has Khamenei crushed Iran protests using 5,000 brutal foreign fighters?Fresh reports suggest Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's clerical regime turned to Arabic-speaking Shia militias from Iraq to brutally crush the Iran protests. It imported nearly 5,000 fighters under the cover of religious pilgrimages to suppress the anti-Khamenei uprising. The spike in deaths of protesters coincides with the arrival of the militias. Protests seem to have been quelled for now.

Australian Open 2026, Day 1 Schedule: Top seeds Alcaraz, Sabalenka headline opening dayCarlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will headline the big names who will be playing on the opening day of the Australian Open 2026 in Melbourne on Sunday, January 18.

Red Fort bomber appointed without checks: ED exposes Al-Falah's fake doctors scamThe ED has flagged the appointment of the Red Fort blast accused at Al-Falah University as it charges the institution's chairman in a major regulatory fraud and money laundering case.

Why Bollywood cinematic universes aren't always safe bets at the box officeBollywood has been betting big on cinematic universes lately, but the formula doesn't always pay off at the box office. This Cinematic Saturday, we dissect various elements like hype, content, star power and VFX that go into crafting a cinematic universe.

Broken idols brought from outside: Yogi Adityanath on Kashi ghat demolition rowControversy erupted earlier this week after videos showing bulldozers at the Manikarnika Ghat in Varanasi, as part of a redevelopment drive, went viral. Protests erupted near the site, with locals alleging that several idols were damaged.

Men rape marginalised women for pilgrimage: Congress MLA's remark sparks rowPhool Singh Baraiya, senior MLA from Madhya Pradesh, also said that no man can rape a woman if the latter does not have consent.

AR Rahman blames Bollywood for his decline, but post-2015 duds hurt his legacy tooIn a recent interview, AR Rahman blamed his recent Bollywood slowdown on non-creative power shifts and communal whispers. Truth is, his post-2015 duds contributed to his decline.

sports.headline: First bird poop, and then nest: Badminton match once again halted at India Open The India Open Super 750 women's doubles semifinal was halted due to debris from a bird's nest. The incident adds to ongoing concerns over venue conditions and match disruptions in Delhi.

Vihaan Malhotra's Houdini act helps India pull off miracle rescue vs Bangladesh U19 World Cup: India pulled off a Houdini act in the group-stage match against Bangladesh on Saturday, January 17. From a position that few could make a comeback, India managed to beat Bangladesh by 18 runs, courtesy of Vihaan Malhotra.

India, Bangladesh players shake hands in U19 World Cup after BCB clarification U19 World Cup: India and Bangladesh players shook hands at the end of the game after the toss controversy at the start of the match. The gestures were made after Bangladesh Cricket Board issued a public clarification on the issue.

Australian Open 2026, Day 1 Schedule: Top seeds Alcaraz, Sabalenka headline opening day Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will headline the big names who will be playing on the opening day of the Australian Open 2026 in Melbourne on Sunday, January 18.

Tata Steel Chess tournament in Netherlands halted as protestors dump 2025 kg of coal The Tata Steel Chess Tournament in Wijk aan Zee was halted after Extinction Rebellion activists dumped 2,025 kg of coal, blocking access and accusing the company of sportswashing and pollution.

Australian Open 2026: Melbourne gives Roger Federer the farewell it never could Roger Federer's return at the Australian Open opening ceremony turned emotional as he recreated an iconic ball-boy catch, shared the stage with legends and finally received the farewell he never had.

Manchester United's Michael Carrick era starts by denting City's title hopes Manchester United started their Michael Carrick era by outplaying Manchester City and denting Pep Guardiola and his side's title charge with a 2-0 win on Saturday, December 17.

Change World Cup groups: Bangladesh propose radical idea to avoid India travel Bangladesh have proposed the idea of changing their group for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 to minimise their travel to India. The BCB has released a press note on the developments from the meeting.

Clinical UP Warriorz complete double over Mumbai to continue WPL 2026 revival Meg Lanning and Phoebe Litchfield's fifties and a disciplined bowling performance helped the UP Warriorz complete a double over the Mumbai Indians on Saturday, January 17.

Handshake snub unintentional: Bangladesh offer clarification after U19 row U19 World Cup: Bangladesh Cricket Board have offered clarification after their U19 captain did not shake hands at the toss with Ayush Mhatre. The BCB has called the snub unintentional.

Chinnaswamy Stadium gets government nod to host IPL, international matchesThe Karnataka state cricket association announced on Saturday, January 17 that they have got the clearance to host IPL and international games at the Chinnaswamy stadium.

BBL: Indian origin all-rounder wreaks havoc in Strikers vs Renegades matchBBL: Indian origin all-rounder Jerrssis Wadia wreaked havoc in Adelaide Strikers' match against Melbourne Renegades. Bowling the first over of the match, Wadia picked up two wickets in the first two balls.

U-19 World Cup: India and Bangladesh Captains Refuse Handshake Amid TensionsThis report highlights the high drama witnessed during the Under-19 World Cup match between India and Bangladesh. At the time of the toss, both captains reportedly refused to shake hands, a move attributed to the ongoing diplomatic tensions between the two nations. The programme discusses how this 'no handshake policy' is becoming a new form of weaponisation in cricket, reflecting broader political protests on the field. The speaker notes that this trend has intensified since 'Operation Sindoor', citing previous instances where Indian and Pakistani captains, including Harmanpreet Kaur and Fatima Sana, avoided the customary gesture during the Asia Cup and ICC events. The discussion emphasizes that 'politics is now seeping into the game and it has now completely taken over when it comes to India matches', extending beyond the traditional India-Pakistan rivalry to include India-Bangladesh encounters. The segment explores the implications of these diplomatic frictions on the future of international cricket and the role of governing bodies like the BCCI and ICC in managing such on-field incidents.

Chamuditha's record 192 powers Sri Lanka in U19 World CupViran Chamuditha made history for Sri Lanka U19 by scoring a record 192 against Japan in their ICC U19 Men's Cricket World Cup 2026 opener, surpassing the previous highest individual score in tournament history.

Mohammed Siraj hints workload management may have led to T20 World Cup 2026 snubIndia pacer Mohammed Siraj feels that his workload management may have led to being snubbed from the T20 World Cup 2026 squad. Siraj played the last edition of the tournament and played a crucial role in India's win.

IND vs NZ: Will Arshdeep Singh get to play series-decider in Indore? Siraj weighs inIND vs NZ: Selection questions surround Arshdeep Singh ahead of the IND vs NZ series decider in Indore, with Mohammed Siraj explaining bowling roles and Gautam Gambhir's earlier frustration still fresh.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi breaks Kohli's record, but throws away good start vs BangladeshVaibhav Suryavanshi went past Virat Kohli's tally in Youth ODIs during his fifty against Bangladesh in the U19 World Cup 2026. Suryavanshi recovered from a poor start to his U19 World Cup campaign.

Courtney Walsh named Zimbabwe's bowling consultant ahead of T20 World Cup 2026Zimbabwe have strengthened their T20 World Cup preparations by appointing legendary fast bowler Courtney Walsh as bowling consultant. They will begin their T20 World Cup campaign against Oman at the Sinhalese Sports Club Ground in Colombo on 9 February.

Bangladesh players union chief receives death threats amid dispute with BCBCWAB president Mohammad Mithun reveals receiving death threats amid escalating conflict with BCB. The controversy follows players' boycott over disparaging remarks by BCB director Najmul Islam against their players.

Djokovic dismisses retirement talk, backs himself for Australian Open gloryNovak Djokovic remained bullish about his chances during the Australian Open 2026 and dismissed talks of retirement. Djokovic will be stepping onto the court, eyeing a record 25th grand slam title.

Shreyanka Patil reflects on 14-month injury layoff after first WPL five-wicket haulRoyal Challengers Bengaluru spinner Shreyanka Patil reflects on her five-wicket haul and comeback after 14 months out due to injury, following RCB's 32-run win over Gujarat Giants in the T20 tournament.

Not even 5 percent of Rohit's success: India coach slammed for remarksManoj Tiwary calls out Ryan ten Doeschate for comments on Rohit Sharma, emphasising the need for respect towards the former Indian captain's record and warning against demoralising statements from team management.

U-19 World Cup: India, Bangladesh captains snub handshake amid political tensionsIndia Under-19 captain Ayush Mhatre refused to shake hands with his Bangladesh counterpart during their Under-19 World Cup fixture. India and Bangladesh are in a political stand-off, amid recent controversial events.

Damien Martyn wins battle against life-threatening meningitis, shares beach photoFormer Australia cricketer Damien Martyn opened up on his life-threatening battle with meningitis infection. The former batter recalled his days of struggle and thanked family, friends and medical staff for constant support in his first public statement since recovery.

U-19 World Cup: Ali Raza's moment of madness results in comical run outPakistan under-19 fast bowler Ali Raza was run out in a bizarre fashion during their tournament opener against England in the Under-19 World Cup 2026. Pakistan lost the match by 37 runs as they failed to chase down 211.

U19 WC Highlights: Bangladesh 146-all-out, India win thriller in BulawayoIndia (IND) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Highlights, U19 World Cup: BAN (146-all-out in 28.3 ov). India have somehow managed to make a miraculous escape against Bangladesh. After staying behind till the final 10 overs, they managed to make a tremendous comeback and win the game by 18 runs.

Axar way ahead of Jadeja, don't know why he's not in ODI squad: Former India batterFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Mohammad Kaif has questioned the selectors for not picking Axar Patel in the squad for the ongoing ODI series against New Zealand. Kaif hailed Axar's batting and bowling prowess better than Jadeja.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
